Future of Fletcher-Hackwood to be decided

By James Bithell

The future of Grace Fletcher-Hackwood as YUSU's Academic and Welfare Officer will be decided at 13:00 today when results from this week's UGM are released.

Womens' committee UGM motion strongly criticised

By James Bithell

A motion proposed at the recent Union General Meeting to allow male students to attend YUSU Women's Committee has sparked campus-wide debate regarding the future welfare of female students at York.

Destruction of Amnesty display under investigation

By James Bithell

Campus security is investigating the destruction of Amnesty International posters protesting the Chinese government's human rights record.

YUSU sabbatical officer calls for dismissal of Fletcher-Hackwood

By James Bithell

YUSU Student Development and Charities Officer Joey Ellis has publicly called for students to support the vote of no confidence against her YUSU sabbatical colleague Academic and Welfare Officer Grace Fletcher-Hackwood.

University finance report shows income rise of 12%

Recently released statements for the financial year finishing June 2007 report a 12% rise in the University's total income over the past 12 months.

Ex-student pleads guilty to charge of conspiracy to defraud University

By James Bithell

A former York student and his accomplice have pleaded guilty to one charge of conspiracy to defraud the University.

Arms Trade Report criticises York for taking on 59 Military Projects

By James Bithell

The University of York has received just under PS8m in funding from British arms companies, according to a recent report.

University ethics committee told to exempt research

The mandate of a proposed ethical investment steering group will not be extend to research, Nouse has learned.

York taking ethical investment motion to NUS

By James Bithell

YUSU has taken its campaign against unethical investment to a national level by submitting a motion to the NUS.

Fletcher-Hackwood defiant in the face of looming no confidence vote

YUSU Academic and Welfare Officer Grace Fletcher-Hackwood is set to face a vote of no confidence at the next UGM after admitting assaulting a student.

Financial statements reveal UYCU annual turnover of PS29,000

By James Bithell

The University of York Christian Union (UYCU) has reported a PS29,000 turnover in the past year.

Rising Hes East prices spark worries of campus inequality

By James Bithell

Goodricke students moving to the Heslington East development in 2009 look set to face higher accommodation fees.

Library budget cut for second time in two years

By James Bithell

The JB Morrell Library is facing a second round of budget cuts in two years.

External consultant to assess 'ongoing problems and pressure points' in YUSU

By James Bithell

YUSU has commissioned an external consultant to assess both sabbatical and non-sabbatical officers in response to concerns over growing workloads and pressurized roles.

Presidential hopefuls begin positioning

By James Bithell

The race for the next YUSU President is beginning to take shape as potential candidates reveal their intentions to succeed current President Anne-Marie Canning.

Funding cuts threaten NSDF

The Council has discontinued fourteen years of PS52,000 worth annual sponsorship to "refocus" their investment, causing outrage among students.

YUSU begin negotiations with FTR

By James Bithell

YUSU representatives challenged the recent price hikes on the FTR buses in a meeting with FirstYork officials last week. YUSU Officers met with FirstYork in an attempt to address the issue.

Bennett urges new JCRC chairs to focus on students and ignore tempting politics

Former Vanbrugh JCRC Chair Ryan Bennett has urged the new group of college chairs to use their time in Senate campaigning for their college's students.

New Vanbrugh provost selected

Current dean of Vanbrugh college David Efird has been appointed as the new Vanbrugh Provost, a role that takes effect on October 1 2008 when current provost Alan Warren retires after 24 years.

Support for poor students safeguarded by University

The University has decided to increase its total bursary budget by 9% in order to accommodate government changes in bursary brackets, while maintaining the current levels of support enjoyed by those in the lowest bracket. Under the new scheme no students on existing bursaries will suffer financially.

York on University Challenge offensive

Years of underachievement on BBC Two's University Challenge are set to come to an end as YUSU announced a reinvigoration of the selection and training processes this week.

QAA returns report of confidence in University

The University of York has received a 'full confidence' judgement in its institutional audit, conducted last term.

Hitch to Morocco fails ratification tests

This year's Hitch to Morocco will not take place with the backing of YUSU after it was deemed too great a risk to Union liability.

Derwent kitchens hit by microwave arson

Residents of Derwent C and D blocks face discipinary action after a series of explosive incidents involving foodstuffs in their microwaves.

University bridges to remain closed

Two major bridges on campus have been closed following a structural survey which revealed "concerns about their loading."

Students to choose between Viking Raid and ethical merchandise

This term's Viking Raid bar crawl is facing cancellation after YUSU revealed that it would be forced to scrap its Ethical Merchandising Policy in order to source t-shirts for the event.

YUSU refuses to provide condoms for Vanbrugh event

By James Bithell

The organisers of this weekend's Porno V event have been told by YUSU that they will not be supplied with condoms to distribute.

Derwent financial confusion prompts YUSU investigation

Derwent college finances will be investigated as it was revealed to YUSU that funds from last June's Big D event have gone missing.

NUS set for overhaul after reforms are passed

NUS members have voted in favour of a whitepaper that will overhaul the organisation's governance structure at Tuesday's Extraordinary Conference.

YUSU criticised for debate condemnation

York Union Debating Society has spoken out about the YUSU Executive's decision to send a letter to the Oxford Union President, condemning his invitation to controversial figures Nick Griffin and David Irving.
